conversion_verification.notes: The second image appears to be a 3D model/cutaway, but it is presented in an almost pure top-down orthographic view rather than an angled/isometric perspective, triggering automatic rejection per rubric.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Rejected due to near/pure top-down orthographic presentation.

detected_errors.description: Automatic rejection condition met: the 3D render is shown in a (near) pure top-down orthographic view rather than an angled/isometric cutaway view.

summary: Despite 3D-like elements (thickness, furniture, cutaway), the output is presented in a near/pure top-down orthographic view, failing the required angled/isometric 3D conversion criterion.
